Question
========

In a study examining the relationship between attending a statistics college (*x*) and developing psychosis (*y*), a correlation of r = 0.30 was found. This can be interpreted as

Answerlist
----------

* A 30% decrease in errors of predicting y with x.
* A 9% decrease in errors of predicting y with x.
* That for 30% of all y, prediction ($\hat{y}$) = y.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* A 30% decrease in errors from predicting y with x.: Incorrect
* A 9% decrease in errors of predicting y with x.: Correct
* That for 30% of all y, prediction ($\hat{y}$) = y.: Incorrect
